cards package

Submodules

cards.main module

cards.main.authenticate_user(username)[source]

checks the user using password authentication. If the user does not exist, then the user must set a password. For both cases, the password will be asked. If not correct, then they must enter their password until it is correct.

Parameters:

str (username) – The username to check if exists and match their password against.

cards.main.calculate_winner(card1, card2)[source]

Compares p1s and p2s cards to see who wins. :param list: Player1’s card for comparison :type list: card1 :param list: Player2’s card for comparison :type list: card2

Returns:

a number represent whether player 1 or player 2 won.

Return type:

int

cards.main.check_password(username, password, filename)[source]

Checks the player’s account username with their password to see if it is correcty matched with the textfile DB.

Parameters:

  • str (filename) – The player’s account username

  • str – The player’s account password to match with username.

  • str – location of textfile containing account usernames and password

Returns:

True of False result of matching each line on textfile database.

Return type:

bool

cards.main.check_user_exists(username, filename)[source]

checks the user exists inside the textfile DB

Parameters:

  • str (filename) – the username to check in textfile DB.

  • str – the file location.

Returns:

the result of whether the username exists as an account on the textfile database.

Return type:

boolean

cards.main.create_user(username, password, filename)[source]

adds a new user inside the textfile DB

Parameters:

  • str (filename) – the username to check in textfile DB.

  • str – the user password to add to the textfile DB.

  • str – the file location.

cards.main.display_winner(player1, player2)[source]

show who won, with both players results.

Parameters:

  • object (player2) – player1 with their cards and name

  • object – player2 with their cards and name

cards.main.enter_username(player)[source]

The player is asked for their username

Parameters:

str (player) – player1 or player2 to be displayed in when asking for input from a player.

Returns:

The player’s username

Return type:

str

cards.main.main()[source]

Runs the main game.

cards.main.play_game(name1, name2, deck)[source]

runs the game round by round until the deck of cards are empty.

Parameters:

  • str (name2) – The player’s account username

  • str – The player 2’s account username

  • list (deck) – The stack of cards to take the top cards from.

Returns:

  • object (player1) – contains p1’s name and the cards they acquired throughout playing the game.

  • object (player2) – contains p2’s name and the cards they acquired throughout playing the game.

cards.main.setup_cards()[source]

Prepares the game by creating a stack of cards, called a deck.

Returns:

list – the sequential deck of cards for the game, randomised(shuffled).

Return type:

deck
